thread.title: Lamar Odom is relocating to a Los Angeles rehab center
thread.title_full: Lamar Odom is relocating to a Los Angeles rehab center

title: Lamar Odom is relocating to a Los Angeles rehab center
text:
Lamar Odom is relocating to a Los Angeles rehab center Updated: Lamar Odom is taking his first steps on the road to recovery. More >> Lamar Odom is taking his first steps on the road to recovery. More >> Petticoat Junction star Pat Woodell dies at 71 Pat Woodell, who played Bobbie Jo Bradley on the 1960s sitcom Petticoat Junction, died of cancer on Sept. 29 at her home in Fallbrook, Calif., The Associated Press reports. She was 71. More >> Pat Woodell, who played Bobbie Jo Bradley on the 1960s sitcom Petticoat Junction, died of cancer on Sept. 29 at her home in Fallbrook, Calif., The Associated Press reports. She was 71. More >> A Christmas Story star Peter Billingsley is engaged Peter Billingsley, who played Ralphie in the 1983 holiday classic A Christmas Story, is engaged, Us Weekly reports. More >> Peter Billingsley, who played Ralphie in the 1983 holiday classic A Christmas Story, is engaged, Us Weekly reports. More >> Son of Storage Wars: Miami star charged with murdering a family friend during viewing party Hashim Pew, the son of Storage Wars: Miami star Kevin Pew, has been charged with first-degree murder after he allegedly shot and killed a family friend during a viewing party, the Sun Sentinel reports. More >> Hashim Pew, the son of Storage Wars: Miami star Kevin Pew, has been charged with first-degree murder after he allegedly shot and killed a family friend during a viewing party, the Sun Sentinel reports. More >> 
By Shelli Weinstein, 
Lamar Odom is taking his first steps on the road to recovery. 
A source tells UsWeekly that Odom will be moved to a rehabilitation center in Los Angeles to continue his treatment. 
" Khloe [Kardashian] and Kris [Jenner] decided to move Lamar to a rehab center in L.A. so they can all be closer to him," the source said to Us Weekly . "He's still getting better little by little...It's all baby steps, very slow. Everything is going very slow." 
Lamar Odom breathing on his own and communicating with family 
Odom is likely to be moved sometime this week. The former basketball star's condition has continued to improve after he was found unconscious at a brothel in Nevada on Oct. 13. He was airlifted to a Las Vegas hospital where he had been in a coma after multiple strokes, but woke up over the weekend and has been able to communicate with family. 
The source added that Odom has been speaking more though he has a challenging journey ahead of him to fully recover.
